active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the PRBG process (seed -> initialization -> pseudorandom bits -> keys) using NIST SP 800-90A/B excerpts; the partner performs a teach-back quiz, switching roles. Link to prior knowledge: Differentiate PRNG vs. TRNG from introductory cryptography modules.
active_learning.problem_solving: Design a secure key generation workflow for an IoT device with constrained entropy: 1) Identify/validate entropy sources per SP 800-90B. 2) Generate seed. 3) Initialize PRBG (e.g., CTR_DRBG from SP 800-90A). 4) Produce bits per SP 800-133. Assess entropy needs (e.g., 256 bits) and handle reseeding.
